Articles.Content:
So I was sitting at my computer one night when I thought about how hard making a planet in Kopernicus is. I remembered I had a planet texture maker (Textures for Planets) and I decided to share this with the modding community. All I ask is that if you use any of these textures, please credit me in the planet description. To start out, here is a nice dry planet. Thanks, and happy worldbuilding!

Edited November 3, 2021 by Hypersonic Was Taken Again
A nice little (not really) gas giant texture:
Fungusy Boi. No comment
By the way, if anyone has their own planet textures that they feel like posting here, go right ahead. The more, the merrier!

New planet texture. Made on a different software (DonJon) Might be of lower quality but it probably works

Feel free to send screenshots of worlds made with these textures! I'd love to see them!

https://imgur.com/ELByxpS

For some reason, KSP forums and Imgur were being weird today, so had to post the link. Sorry if it looks similar to the previous texture, but I like some variation within a set theme. Enjoy!

Ok, so this is just for fun (but so is the rest of this) but I'm going to post brief planet names and descriptions, so if you want a preset, you can have one, but if you want more originality, that option still exists. To start:

Fernos

A planet with no atmosphere but a massive ocean of lava. A few islands further North than the main Southern landmass have been discovered, but are incredibly hazardous to land on, and as such, should be avoided in favor of the Southern Polar Continent (made with Donjon)

Edited November 15, 2021 by Hypersonic Was Taken Again
Please somebody else comment here, it's lonely,  I want your feedback, suggestions, and creations!

its duna but wet lol

gas planet that is cool and maybe even cold

Been quite a while, but I haven't forgotten about this thread! To celebrate the not-at-all anticipated return of this kind-of series, here's another texture from T4P that I had stored away.

More to come...
Ok, I planned to wait and make some more textures, but I found this one in my Imgur archives and I thought it looked too cool to not post here.
Here's a fun one.

Licensing and legal stuff

Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License

Basically, Use this stuff, edit it, but credit me and don't sell it. 
Now, with that out of the way, onto more planets!

Finding texture generators is really hard on the internet, although it is useful to have texture generators out there as well. I don't mean to self promo but I made a video with a planet texture I thought was cool. 

 

I created it using a Blender planet generator from Gumroad. I'll find it later if I can since I have a (way too long) list of planet texture generators in my Google Docs files. Here's the Docs file: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jstGqrESD3ir-TowbgMbNYni89-A_B4oIycCLezJilA/edit?usp=sharing

Oh wait I found it. Here it is: https://verdestudios.gumroad.com/l/sRaZL
